4035 NORTH STRATFORD RD NE, ATLANTA GA 30342
properties.tree_description: Numbered flagging tape as Tree 1 Reason for Removal:OtherComments:The tree exhibits a noticeable lean toward the property. Waning large patches of fruiting bodies, consistent with Ganoderma, are located at the base, indicating advanced decay and compromised structural integrity below grade. The more vertical yet subordinate leader is dead. At the site where necrosis appears to begin, there is a substantial amount of decay and noticeable woodpecker damage. Given the extent of decay at the base and within the canopy, and the presence of lean, this tree poses a significant structural hazard and should be removed as soon as possible.
Picture of treeReason for Removal:Dead treeComments:dead -

The trunk is covered with thick vines (look like ivy or similar), which can conceal defects, damage the bark, and compete for resources. There also appear to be some dead/sparse branches visible in the canopy.Reason for Removal:Dying treeComments:(Do not know the exact Tree number, Also this tree is dying and two branches already fell into yard.

		Parcel Number:T14 00480004011 001 *Block:--Lot:--Subdivision:--

See report Reason for Removal:OtherComments:This mature Southern Red Oak shows multiple signs of decline. Fruiting bodies are present around the base, with an orange to reddish coloration and some dark blackish areas visible within the fissures. While probing the root collar area, I discovered a slightly hidden basal cavity and was able to insert a 3-foot rod freely, confirming an open void beneath the tree rather than within the main trunk. Sounding on the fluted area along the tension side, facing the fence, produced a hollow tone, indicating an underlying void beneath that section of the base.
